description: Lists the EC2 instances providing user-based subscriptions.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: You can use the following filters to streamline results: Status InstanceId (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return more specific results from a describe or list operation. You can use filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. Attribute (string) --- The name of an attribute to use as a filter. Operation (string) --- The type of search (For example, eq, geq, leq) Value (string) --- Value of the filter.

nested_items.name: InstanceSummaries
nested_items.description: An array of InstanceSummary resources that contain details about the instances that provide user-based subscriptions and also meet the request criteria.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the EC2 instance, which provides user-based subscriptions.

nested_items.name: LastStatusCheckDate
nested_items.description: The date of the last status check.

nested_items.name: Products
nested_items.description: A list of provided user-based subscription products.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of an EC2 instance resource.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: The status message for an EC2 instance.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The next token used for paginated responses. When this field isn't empty, there are additional elements that the service hasn't included in this request. Use this token with the next request to retrieve additional objects.
